info.name: MenuMate API v1 - Comprehensive Collection
info.description:
Complete API documentation for MenuMate Backend - A restaurant management and discovery platform.

## Overview

MenuMate is a comprehensive restaurant management system that allows restaurant owners to manage restaurants, menus, staff, and for customers to discover and review places.

## Base URL

`http://localhost:8080/api/v1`

## Authentication

Most endpoints require JWT authentication. Send the access token via Authorization header or cookies.

- Header: `Authorization: Bearer`
    
- Cookies: `access_token` and `refresh_token` are set by the server when you login/register.
    

## API Versioning

All endpoints are prefixed with `/api/v1`.

## Errors

Standard error format (refactored unified schema):

```json
{
  "message": "Short human readable explanation",
  "code": "snake_case_machine_code",
  "field": "field_name_if_applicable",
  "error": "internal or debug detail (may be omitted in production)"
}
```

Examples:
```json
{
  "message": "email already in use",
  "code": "email_already_in_use",
  "field": "email"
}
```
```json
{
  "message": "invalid credentials",
  "code": "invalid_credentials"
}
```

## Success

Standard success format may be either:

``` json
{ "message": "Operation completed successfully", "data": { ... } }
```
OR an object payload (e.g., login returns tokens).

request.description:
Register a new user account.

**Registration Rules:**
You MUST provide: 
- `username` (unique)
- `password`
- Either `email` OR `phone_number` (at least one)
- `auth_provider` must match the primary credential used: `EMAIL` when using email, `PHONE` when using phone-only signup, `GOOGLE` for OAuth flow.

**Request Body Fields (Standard Email Registration):**
- `username` (string, required): 3-50 alphanumeric characters
- `email` (string, required if auth_provider=EMAIL): Valid email address
- `phone_number` (string, required if auth_provider=PHONE): E.164 format (e.g. +15551234567)
- `password` (string, required): 6-100 characters
- `auth_provider` (string, required): One of `EMAIL`, `PHONE`, `GOOGLE`
- `first_name` (string, optional): 2-50 alphabetic characters
- `last_name` (string, optional): 2-50 alphabetic characters
- `role` (string, optional): One of `CUSTOMER`, `OWNER`, `MANAGER`, `STAFF`, `ADMIN` (defaults to `CUSTOMER`)

**Examples:**
_Email Based:_
```json
{
  "username": "johndoe",
  "email": "john.doe@example.com",
  "password": "securepassword123",
  "auth_provider": "EMAIL"
}
```
_Phone Based:_
```json
{
  "username": "janedoe",
  "phone_number": "+15551234567",
  "password": "securepassword123",
  "auth_provider": "PHONE"
}
```

**Conflict Handling (409):**
- `username already exists`
- `email already exists`
- `phone number already exists`

**Response:** Returns created user object without password hash.

request.description:
Redirect to Google OAuth2 consent screen.

**Response:**
- Redirects to Google OAuth consent page
- User authorizes the application
- Google redirects to callback URL

**Usage:**
1. Direct users to this URL in browser
2. User completes OAuth flow
3. Google calls the callback endpoint
4. Application receives tokens

Handle Google OAuth2 callback and authenticate user.

**Query Parameters:**
- `code` (string, required): Authorization code from Google
- `state` (string, optional): State parameter for CSRF protection

**Response:**
```json
{
  "access_token": "jwt_access_token",
  "refresh_token": "jwt_refresh_token",
  "user": {
    "id": "user_id",
    "email": "user@gmail.com",
    "username": "google_user123",
    "first_name": "John",
    "last_name": "Doe",
    "auth_provider": "GOOGLE",
    "role": "CUSTOMER"
  }
}
```

**Notes:**
- Creates new user with `auth_provider=GOOGLE` if first-time login
- Links existing account if the email matches an existing user
- Username is generated or derived if not provided

item.name: Protected Auth

request.description:
Send email verification OTP to user.

**Request Body Fields:**
- `email` (string, required): Valid email address to verify

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Verification email sent successfully"
}
```

**Notes:**
- Requires valid access token
- Sends 6-digit OTP to email
- OTP expires in configured minutes (default: 15 minutes)
- Maximum attempts limit applies

Resend OTP for email verification.

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "OTP resent successfully"
}
```

**Notes:**
- Requires valid access token
- Invalidates previous OTP
- Same expiry and attempt limits apply
- Rate limiting may apply

Verify OTP and mark email as verified.

**Request Body Fields:**
- `code` (string, required): 6-digit OTP code

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Email verified successfully",
  "user": {
    "id": "user_id",
    "email": "john.doe@example.com",
    "is_verified": true
  }
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `400`: Invalid or expired OTP
- `429`: Too many attempts
- `401`: Invalid access token

request.description:
Upload a menu image to start an OCR job.

Authorization: Requires bearer access token.

Form Data:
- menuImage (file, required): Image of the menu.

Response (200): Returns extracted structured menu data if immediate processing succeeds; otherwise job status pending.

Fetch OCR job status and extracted data if completed.

Path Params:
- jobId: OCR job identifier.

Authorization: Requires bearer access token.

Delete (cancel) an OCR job and its processed data.

Path Params:
- `id` (string, required): OCR job id.

Authorization: Bearer token required.

Responses:
- 200: `{ "message": "OCR job deleted successfully" }`
- 404: `{ "message": "ocr job not found" }`
- 401: Unauthorized token missing/invalid

Retry processing a failed OCR job. Only jobs in failed/error status can be retried.

Path Params:
- `id`: OCR job id.

Responses:
- 200: Returns updated job `{ id, status: 'pending' }`
- 409: `{ "message": "job not in failed state" }`
- 404: Job not found

item.name: Notifications

request.description:
Create a notification (system/internal usage).

Body Fields:
- `user_id` (string) target user
- `title` (string) short heading
- `message` (string) detailed message
- `type` (string) classification (e.g. MENU_EVENT, SYSTEM, ALERT)

Responses:
- 201: Created notification object
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized

Mark all (or filtered) notifications as read for a user.

Responses:
- 200: `{ "message": "marked as read" , count: <number> }`

- 404: User not found

WebSocket endpoint that streams live notifications.

Upgrade Request: `GET /notifications/ws` with standard WS headers.

Client Message Format (optional ping): `{ "type": "ping" }`
Server Push Format: `{ id, title, message, type, created_at }`

Note: Postman can't maintain custom WS auth via bearer automatically; open a raw WebSocket client and include `Authorization: Bearer <token>` in the headers (if supported) or use a token query param if backend allows (not recommended).

request.description:
Create a new restaurant.

**Request Body Fields (multipart/form-data):**
- `restaurant_name` (string, required): Restaurant name
- `restaurant_phone` (string, required): Restaurant phone number
- `about` (string, optional): Restaurant description
- `tags` (string, optional): Comma-separated tags (e.g., "Italian,Pizza,Pasta") or multiple form keys
- `logo_image` (file, optional): Restaurant logo image file
- `verification_docs` (file, optional): Business verification documents
- `cover_image` (file, optional): Restaurant cover image

**Tag Input Formats:**
1. CSV: `"Italian,Pizza,Pasta"`
2. Multiple keys: `tags=Italian&tags=Pizza`
3. Array notation: `tags[]=Italian&tags[]=Pizza`

**Automatic Fields:**
- `manager_id`: Set from authenticated user
- `slug`: Generated from restaurant name
- `verification_status`: Set to "pending"
- `average_rating`: Initialized to 0
- `view_count`: Initialized to 0

**Response (snake_case):**
```json
{
  "id": "restaurant_id",
  "slug": "the-italian-corner",
  "restaurant_name": "The Italian Corner",
  "manager_id": "user_id",
  "restaurant_phone": "+1234567890",
  "about": "Restaurant description",
  "tags": ["Italian", "Pizza"],
  "previous_slugs": [],
  "verification_status": "pending",
  "average_rating": 0,
  "view_count": 0,
  "created_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z",
  "updated_at": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
}
```

request.description:
Update restaurant information.

**Path Parameters:**
- `slug` (string, required): Restaurant slug

**Request Body Fields:**
- `name` (string, optional): Updated restaurant name
- `phone` (string, optional): Updated phone number
- `about` (string, optional): Updated description
- `tags` (array, optional): Updated tags array
- `logo_image` (string, optional): Updated logo URL

**Authorization:**
- Only restaurant manager/owner can update
- Admin users can update any restaurant

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Restaurant updated successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": "restaurant_id",
    "slug": "the-italian-corner-updated",
    "name": "The Italian Corner - Updated",
    "updated_at": "2024-01-20T15:45:00Z"
  }
}
```

**Notes:**
- Slug is regenerated if name changes
- Update timestamp is automatically set
- Verification status may be reset if significant changes are made

Delete a restaurant (soft delete).

**Path Parameters:**
- `id` (string, required): Restaurant MongoDB ObjectID (24-character hex string)

**Authorization:**
- Only restaurant manager/owner can delete their restaurant
- Admin users can delete any restaurant

**Response:**
```json
{
  "message": "Restaurant deleted successfully"
}
```

**Error Responses:**
- `404`: Restaurant not found
- `403`: Not authorized to delete this restaurant
- `400`: Invalid ObjectID format

**Notes:**
- This is a soft delete (sets `is_deleted` flag)
- Restaurant data is preserved for audit purposes
- Associated menus and items are also soft deleted
- Operation is irreversible for non-admin users

Get all branches of a restaurant by slug with pagination.

**Path Parameters:**
- `slug` (string, required): Restaurant slug

**Query Parameters:**

if(!err && res.code===200){ try { const j=res.json(); if(j.access_token){ pm.environment.set('access_token', j.access_token); pm.environment.set('token_expiry', (Date.now()+15*60*1000).toString()); } if(j.refresh_token) pm.environment.set('refresh_token', j.refresh_token);}catch(e){} } setAuthHeader(); });
// Capture nested or flat token responses globally

if(j.tokens){ if(j.tokens.access_token){ pm.environment.set('access_token', j.tokens.access_token); pm.environment.set('token_expiry',(Date.now()+15*60*1000).toString()); } if(j.tokens.refresh_token) pm.environment.set('refresh_token', j.tokens.refresh_token); }
